facts.fact_text: South Africa's gross foreign exchange reserves reached $80.193 billion in January 2026.

evidences.evidence_text: Gross foreign exchange reserves in South Africa rose to $80.193 billion in January 2026, the largest value since records began in 1998, from $75.892 billion in the previous month.

facts.fact_text: The January 2026 reserves figure is the largest since records began in 1998.

evidences.evidence_text: Gross foreign exchange reserves in South Africa rose to $80.193 billion in January 2026, the largest value since records began in 1998, from $75.892 billion in the previous month.

facts.fact_text: Gold reserves increased to $20.670 billion in January 2026 from $17.493 billion in December 2025.

evidences.evidence_text: This was driven by increases in gold reserves ($20.670 billion vs $17.493 billion in December 2025)

facts.fact_text: SDR holdings increased to $6.666 billion in January 2026 from $6.604 billion in December 2025.
Foreign currency reserves increased to $52.857 billion in January 2026 from $51.795 billion.

evidences.evidence_text: foreign currency reserves ($52.857 billion vs $51.795 billion)

facts.fact_text: The forward position decreased to $0.564 billion in January from $1.161 billion in the prior month.

evidences.evidence_text: Meanwhile, the forward position, representing the central bank's unsettled or swap transactions, decreased sharply to $0.564 billion in January from $1.161 billion in the prior month.

evidence.evidence_text: Gross foreign exchange reserves in South Africa rose to $80.193 billion in January 2026, the largest value since records began in 1998, from $75.892 billion in the previous month.
